segments.text: So , Emily , how was your day ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't think you really want to hear about it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It can't have been that bad . Go on and tell me about it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: To be honest , it was horrible ! My manager is such a pain in the neck !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them , my manager blamed them on me !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's not very fair . What did you do ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There wasn't really anything that I could do . There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself . If I had said anything , he would have fired for me for sure .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Does he treat everyone in your department like this ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He treats everyone pretty poorly , but the way he treats me really takes the cake !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I really have no idea . All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at you company ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not really . I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's very sensible . It sounds like you have a good head on you shoulders .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I try to be sensible about it , but it's not very easy . Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's so true . When you have a taste for success , you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way .
segments.speaker: S1
